name: K2-247
scenarioDescription:
The K2-247 Exoplanetary System

K2-247 is a star with 0.74 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.69 times its radius. It is located 848.66 light years away from the solar system.

K2-247 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

K2-247 b

K2-247 b was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 2.25 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, K2-247.

The mass of K2-247 b is 5.83 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-247 b is 2.12 that of Earth. At 5.83 Earth masses, K2-247 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

K2-247 c

K2-247 c was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 6.49 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, K2-247.

The mass of K2-247 c is 6.28 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-247 c is 2.19 that of Earth. At 6.28 Earth masses, K2-247 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-247, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by K2.
